newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia detains Thai ship over oil slick charge.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia detains Thai ship over oil slick charge.

text.p: Malaysian marine police have detained a captain and 14 crew members of a Thai merchant ship suspected to have discharged crude oil in Malaysian waters, the national news agency Bernama reported on Monday.

The crew have been handed over to the Department of Environment while the ship, the "MT Pacific Marine Bangkok" was towed to the island of Pulau Kapas off Malaysia's northern state of Terengganu, Bernama said. The ship was detained on Sunday afternoon after a police aircraft allegedly spotted it discharging oil.
Bernama quoted a marine police official as saying the oil slick measured 15 nautical miles long and 30 to 40 nautical miles wide.
The news agency did not give any further details and officials were not immediately available to comment.
